2.descricao:
Flying

When Angel of Mercy enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.

3.descricao: Target creature gets +3/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
3.texto: Only the warrior who can admit mortal weakness will be bolstered by immortal strength.

5.texto: Some fight for honor and some for gold, but the militia fight for hearth and home.

7.descricao:
Target opponent draws a card.

You gain 7 life.
7.texto: Bargaining with a goblin is like trading with a child; both believe they already own everything.

8.texto: Let the unjust avert their faces and contemplate their peril.

regras.texto: Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

9.texto: "Join the army, see foreign countries!" they'd said.

10.descricao: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

11.descricao: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Champion Lancer by creatures.
11.texto: The flash of his lance projects the pure radiance of his honor.

12.descricao: Whenever Charging Paladin attacks, it gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
12.texto: A true warrior's thoughts are of victory, not death.

13.texto: The heart's courage is the soul's guardian.

14.descricao: When Devout Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

15.texto: The enthusiasm of the young, sharpened by the discipline of a soldier.

16.descricao: Target player skips all combat phases of his or her next turn.
16.texto: Mutual consent is not required for war.

17.texto: Infantry deployment is the art of putting your troops in the wrong place at the right time.

18.descricao: You gain 2 life for each card in your hand.
18.texto: "You'll lose a duel if your enemy comes expecting a war."

19.texto:
". . . Before honor is humility."
—The Bible, Proverbs 15:33

20.descricao: When Loyal Sentry blocks a creature, destroy that creature and Loyal Sentry.

21.descricao: Destroy target creature. Its owner gains 4 life.
21.texto:
"You could die famous or you could die old. I chose old."
—Former soldier

regras.texto: If the spell fails because the target is not there or isn't legal, the owner does not gain any life.

22.descricao: Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
22.texto: Bravery shines brightest in a pure soul.

regras.texto: Only creatures you control when Righteous Charge resolves will get +2/+2. Creatures that come under your control later in the turn will not.

23.descricao: Destroy all tapped creatures. You gain 2 life for each creature destroyed this way.

24.texto: Hunter by instinct, weapon by training.

25.descricao: Whenever Royal Trooper blocks, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
25.texto:
"Fortune does not side with the faint-hearted."
—Sophocles, Phaedra

26.texto:
"For he on honey-dew hath fed,
And drunk the milk of Paradise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge, "Kubla Khan"

27.descricao: Creatures you control get +0/+3 until end of turn.
27.texto: Brute force wins the battles. Conviction wins the wars.

28.descricao: When Venerable Monk enters the battlefield, you gain 2 life.
28.texto: Age wears the flesh but galvanizes the soul.

29.texto: Bitter as wormwood, sweet as mulled wine.

30.descricao: Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
30.texto:
Spirit is the sword and experience the sharpening stone.
—Arabian proverb

31.texto: Two little goblins, out in the sun. Down came a griffin, and then there was one.

32.texto: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.

33.texto: Some fishers like to eat eels, and some eels like to eat fishers.

35.descricao: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.

36.descricao: Creatures and lands target opponent controls don't untap during his or her next untap step.

regras.texto: The creatures and lands are only prevented from untapping during the targeted player's next untap step. They can still can untap during other player's untap steps.
No creatures or lands controlled by the player will untap during his or her next untap step. This includes those which entered the battlefield after Exhaustion resolved.

38.descricao: Look at the top card of target player's library. You may put that card into his or her graveyard.

39.texto: At the sight of the thing the calamari vendor's eyes went wide, but from fear or avarice none could tell.

40.descricao:
Flying

When Ingenious Thief enters the battlefield, look at target player's hand.

41.descricao: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
41.texto: Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch.

regras.texto: It can choose itself. It has to if there are no other creatures.

42.texto: Are merfolk humans with fins, or are humans merfolk with feet?

43.descricao:
Flying

When Owl Familiar enters the battlefield, draw a card, then discard a card.

44.texto: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

45.descricao: Until end of turn, you may tap lands you don't control for mana. Spend this mana only to cast spells.
45.texto: The sea gives, and the sea takes. Some just help with the taking.

46.descricao: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.

regras.texto: If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

47.descricao: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. Put any number of them on the bottom of that library in any order and the rest on top of the library in any order.

48.descricao: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
48.texto: The hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned.

49.texto: When your enemies are denied soldiers, they are denied victory.

regras.texto: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

50.texto: Where air meets water, fish meets talon.

51.descricao: Look at the top two cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the other on the bottom of your library.

regras.texto: If there is only one card in your library, it goes to your hand.

52.texto: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.

53.descricao: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
53.texto:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.
Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

54.texto:
"Many wearing rapiers are afraid of goose-quills."
—William Shakespeare, Hamlet

55.descricao: Put target creature on top of its owner's library.
55.texto: Like the tide, time both ebbs and flows.

56.descricao: Target player takes an extra turn after this one.
56.texto:
"Let's do it again!"
—Squee, goblin cabin hand

regras.texto: If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

57.texto: "I don't want what I don't have. I want more of what I do have."

58.descricao: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.

regras.texto: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner's hands.

59.texto: Its swamp cousin may be meaner, but the vizzerdrix is much bigger.

60.texto:
The water that a ship sails on is the same water that swallows it up.
—Chinese proverb

61.texto: "No bird soars too high, if he soars with his own wings." —William Blake, The Marriage of Heaven and Hell

62.descricao: One or two target creatures gain flying until end of turn.
62.texto: It pays to be at home both on the sea and in the sky.

63.descricao:
Flying

When Abyssal Horror enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.

64.descricao: You draw three cards and you lose 3 life.

65.descricao: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
65.texto: Don't be fooled by their looks. Think of them as little knives with wings.

66.descricao: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
66.texto: Those who live amid decay must expect scavengers.

67.descricao: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
67.texto: It moved through the troops leaving no footprints, save on their souls.

68.descricao: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn.
68.texto: When nightstalkers sing, nothing in creation sleeps.

69.descricao: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
69.texto: "Human tenderness is simply weakness in a pretty package."

70.descricao: When Dakmor Ghoul enters the battlefield, target opponent loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
70.texto:
"Cursed be the sickly forms that err from honest Nature's rule!"
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "Locksley Hall"

71.descricao: When Dakmor Lancer enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature.
71.texto: The darkness of his shield reflects the inky blackness of his soul.

72.descricao: Dakmor Plague deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
72.texto: The tiniest cough can be deadlier than the fiercest dragon.

73.texto: A scorpion this big you won't find curled up in your boot. Maybe around your boot, but not in it.

74.descricao: Dakmor Sorceress's power is equal to the number of Swamps you control.

75.descricao: Destroy target nonblack creature. You gain 3 life.
75.texto:
"Our greatest hope has become our enemy's greatest triumph."
—Court counselor

76.descricao:
Flying

When Dread Reaper enters the battlefield, you lose 5 life.

77.texto: Not all shadows are cast by light—some are cast by darkness.

78.descricao: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

regras.texto: A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

79.descricao: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand, then shuffle your library. You lose 3 life.
79.texto:
He who goes unpunished never learns.
—Greek proverb

80.texto: The touch of death is never gentle.

81.descricao: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
81.texto: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.

regras.texto: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

82.descricao: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
82.texto: I howl my soul to the moon, and the moon howls with me.

84.texto:
"Just as some fool said it couldn't get worse, the rats began to show up."
—Foot soldier

85.descricao: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
85.texto: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

regras.texto: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

86.descricao: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.

87.texto: Luckily for them, it doesn't take much brains to slaughter and maim.

88.descricao: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.

regras.texto: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

89.descricao:
Flying

Whenever Shrieking Specter attacks, defending player discards a card.

90.descricao: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.

91.descricao: Destroy target land or nonblack creature.

92.descricao: Destroy two target nonblack creatures. You lose 5 life.

93.descricao: Cinder Storm deals 7 damage to target creature or player.
93.texto: When the sky's rain has turned to fire, what will put it out?

94.texto: There is much talk about the art of creation. What about the art of destruction?

95.texto: Its voice has the tremor of deafening thunder, its blow the force of an avalanche.

96.texto: You are drawn to your death as a moth to the flame.

97.descricao: Fire Tempest deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

98.texto: They get along so well with their goats because they're practically goats themselves.

99.descricao: Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
99.texto: They have to replace the wheels, they have to replace the boar, and sometimes they have to replace the goblin.

100.descricao: When Goblin Commando enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
100.texto: With a commando around, somebody's gonna get hurt.

101.descricao: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
101.texto: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.

102.texto: The goblins call the gliders "death from above." Everyone else calls them "clods in the clouds."

103.texto: When you're a goblin, you don't have to step forward to be a hero—everyone else just has to step back.

104.descricao: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
104.texto:
"I done forgot more than you'll ever know, pipsqueak."
"Yeah—that's your problem."

105.texto: Goblin mountaineer, barely keeps his family fed.

106.descricao: When Goblin Settler enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
106.texto: Be it ever so crumbled, there's no place like home.

107.texto: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.

108.texto: Once they realized the ogre had more size than speed, the soldiers simply went around it.

109.descricao: Jagged Lightning deals 3 damage to each of two target creatures.

110.descricao: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.

111.descricao: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.
111.texto: Meant to cut through the body and burn straight to the soul.

112.texto: Just because they have a club doesn't mean they're organized.

114.descricao: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
114.texto: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

115.descricao: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

regras.texto: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

116.descricao: Scorching Spear deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
116.texto: Lift your spear as you might lift your glass, and toast your enemy.

117.descricao: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.

119.descricao:
Flying

When Thunder Dragon enters the battlefield, it deals 3 damage to each creature without flying.

120.texto: All orggs know how to kill; training teaches them what to kill.

121.descricao: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
121.texto: One little goblin shook up the ground. When the dust cleared, no one was found.

122.descricao:
Flying

Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
122.texto: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.

123.descricao: Volcanic Hammer deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
123.texto: Fire finds its form in the heat of the forge.

124.descricao: All creatures able to block target creature this turn do so.
124.texto: No earthly armor is protection against this sweetness.

125.texto: In its lair lies a carpet of bones.

126.texto: Stay alert: his lumbering may shake the ground itself, but in water, he glides.

127.texto: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine; and the herd ran violently . . . ." —The Bible, Mark 5:13

128.texto: They were formidable even before they learned the use of weapons.

129.texto: Don't worry about provoking grizzly bears; they come that way.

130.descricao: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

regras.texto: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

131.texto: Rarely seen, hardly heard, never caught.

132.descricao: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
132.texto: The nightstalkers' little game of tease-the-squirrel suddenly took an unexpected turn.

133.texto:
"I am that merry wanderer of the night."
—William Shakespeare,
A Midsummer Night's Dream

134.texto: The dying ask for water because they know it contains life.

135.descricao: Green creatures you control gain forestwalk until end of turn.

136.descricao: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
136.texto: Every seed planted is another lesson the forest can teach us.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-Covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

137.descricao: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
137.texto:
"‘Air superiority?' Not while our archers scan the skies."
—Elvish scout

139.descricao: You may have Pride of Lions assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

regras.texto: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

140.descricao: Shuffle any number of target creature cards from your graveyard into your library.
140.texto: Death just encourages life the more.

141.texto: His true majesty is not in his silver, but in his size.

142.texto: Neither predator nor prey, the elephant chooses its place in the battle.

143.descricao: Squall deals 2 damage to each creature with flying.
143.texto:
"To-night the winds begin to rise . . .
The rooks are blown about the skies . . . ."
—Alfred, Lord Tennyson, In Memoriam

144.descricao: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
144.texto: Summer sends its kiss with warmth and blooming life.

regras.texto: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

145.descricao: Whenever Sylvan Basilisk becomes blocked by a creature, destroy that creature.

146.descricao: Sylvan Yeti's power is equal to the number of cards in your hand.
146.texto: The deeper the wood, the greater its strength.

147.descricao: You may have Thorn Elemental assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

regras.texto: If this creature is attacking a planeswalker, assigning its damage as though it weren't blocked means the damage is assigned to the planeswalker, not to the defending player.

When assigning combat damage, you choose whether you want to assign all damage to blocking creatures, or if you want to assign all of it to the defending player or planeswalker. You can't split the damage assignment between them.
You can decide to assign damage to the defending player or planeswalker even if the blocking creature has protection from green or damage preventing effects on it.
If blocked by a creature with banding, the defending player decides whether or not the damage is assigned "as though it weren't blocked".

148.descricao: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

149.texto: It's hard to say for certain which end is more dangerous.

151.texto: It has the run of the swamps, and it knows it.

152.texto: The forest lives in the elf as the elf lives in the forest.

153.descricao: When Wood Elves enters the battlefield, search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

regras.texto: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
